resources.string: Couldn\'t connect. Enter the full path to xmlrpc.php on your site and try again.
Couldn\'t connect. Required XML-RPC methods are missing on the server.
Couldn\'t connect. Your host is blocking POST requests, and the app needs that in order to communicate with your site. Contact your host to solve this problem.
Couldn\'t connect. We received a 403 error when trying to access your site XMLRPC endpoint. The app needs that in order to communicate with your site. Contact your host to solve this problem.
Couldn\'t connect. The WordPress installation responded with an invalid XML-RPC document.
Couldn\'t connect to the WordPress site due to Timeout error.
Logging out from your account will remove all of @%s’s WordPress.com data from this device, including local drafts and local changes.
This account has two step authentication enabled. Visit your security settings on WordPress.com and generate an application-specific password.

Related Posts displays relevant content from your site below your posts.
The WordPress for Android App Gets a Big Facelift
You can override these settings for individual posts.
When a comment contains any of these words in its content, name, URL, e-mail, or IP, it will be held in the moderation queue. You can enter partial words, so \"press\" will match \"WordPress.\"
When a comment contains any of these words in its content, name, URL, e-mail, or IP, it will be marked as spam. You can enter partial words, so \"press\" will match \"WordPress.\"
Break comment threads into multiple pages.
Allow comments to be nested in threads.
Require approval for comments that include more than this number of links.
Automatically send usage statistics to help us improve WordPress for Android
Editor release notes and bug reporting
Looking for your Other Recent Stats? We\'ve moved them to the Insights page.
Stats couldn\'t be loaded for the required blog
To view your stats, log in to the WordPress.com account you used to connect Jetpack.
To view your stats, enable the JSON API module in Jetpack.
Your WordPress.com account can\'t access Stats on this blog
Stats couldn\'t be accessed without a visible blog
Please remove the widget and re-add it again
Please access the Stats in the app, and try adding the widget later
Add the widget to your home screen to access your Stats in one click.
Explore the list to see which countries and regions generate the most traffic to your site.
Discover what your most-viewed content is, and check how individual posts and pages perform over time.
Learn more about your site’s visibility by looking at the websites and search engines that send the most traffic your way
When your content includes links to other sites, you’ll see which ones your visitors click on the most.
Track the views on each contributor\'s posts, and zoom in to discover the most popular content by each author.
No tagged posts or pages viewed
Get an overview of the most popular topics on your site, as reflected in your top posts from the past week.
If you\'ve uploaded videos using VideoPress, find out how many times they’ve been watched.
If you allow comments on your site, track your top commenters and discover what content sparks the liveliest conversations, based on the most recent 1,000 comments.
Keep track of your followers from various social networking services using publicize.
Keep track of your overall number of followers, and how long each one has been following your site.
Learn more about your search traffic by looking at the terms your visitors searched for to find your site.
Something went wrong during the operation. The spam state wasn\'t changed.
It\'s been %1$s since %2$s was published. Here\'s how the post has performed so far…

Password must contain at least 4 characters
Username must be longer than 4 characters
Username must be shorter than 61 characters
By creating an account you agree to the fascinating %1$sTerms of Service%2$s
Username can only contain lowercase letters (a-z) and numbers
You can\'t use that email address to signup. We are having problems with them blocking some of our email. Use another email provider.
Username must be at least 4 characters
Username may not contain the character “_”
Username must have a least 1 letter (a-z)
We didn\'t find a WordPress.com user with that email address
That email address is already being used
That username is currently reserved but may be available in a couple of days
That email address has already been used. Check your inbox for an activation email. If you don\'t activate you can try again in a few days.
Site address must be at least 4 characters
The site address must be shorter than 64 characters
Site address may not contain the character “_”
You may not use that site address
Site address can only contain lowercase letters (a-z) and numbers
Site address must have at least 1 letter (a-z)
That site is currently reserved but may be available in a couple days
You need a more secure password. Make sure to use 7 or more characters, mix uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers or special characters.
Limit reached. You can try again in 1 minute. Trying again before that will only increase the time you have to wait before the ban is lifted. If you think this is in error, contact support.
The username or password you entered is incorrect

If you usually connect to this site without problems, this error could mean that someone is trying to impersonate the site, and you shouldn\'t continue. Would you like to trust the certificate anyway?

If you remove this viewer, he or she will not be able to visit this site.\n\nWould you still like to remove this viewer?

I want to start over with the site %s

If you want a site but don\'t want any of the posts and pages you have now, our support team can delete your posts, pages, media and comments for you.\n\nThis will keep your site and URL active, but give you a fresh start on your content creation. Just contact us to have your current content cleared out.
Please type in %1$s in the field below to confirm. Your site will then be gone forever.
There was an error in deleting your site. Please contact support for more assistance
Be careful! Deleting your site will also remove your domain(s) listed below.
The domains that will not work once you remove your site
If you are sure, please be sure to take the time and export your content now. It can not be recovered in the future.
Export your site to an XML file
This action can not be undone. Deleting your site will remove all content, contributors, and domains from the site.
All your posts, images, and data will be deleted. And this site’s address (%s) will be lost.
Be careful! Once a site is deleted, it cannot be recovered. Please be sure before you proceed.
Something went wrong. Could not request purchases.
You have active premium upgrades on your site. Please cancel your upgrades prior to deleting your site.
Click the verification link in the email sent to %1$s to confirm your new address
Your posts, pages, and settings will be emailed to you at %s.
It\'s all yours, way to go!

Publish from the park. Blog from the bus. Comment from the café. WordPress goes where you go.
Watch readers from around the world read and interact with your site — in realtime.
Catch up with your favorite sites and join the conversation anywhere, any time.
Your notifications travel with you — see comments and likes as they happen.
Manage your Jetpack-powered site on the go — you\'ve got WordPress in your pocket.
